channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: French authorities said they seized a yacht belonging to a company majority owned by Igor Sechin, the chief executive of Russian oil producer Rosneft who was among a group of individuals sanctioned by the European Union over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/3TYu7vskyS
The protests that rocked Canada are over, but they have undermined Canadians’ faith in their government and hurt the image of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, new polling shows https://t.co/09YmEHB9Px

Volkswagen on Thursday joined other western car makers in suspending production of all vehicles at its factories in Russia, citing its “great dismay and shock” over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/XKhGBZxIgA

Broadcasters around the world are buying the rights to “Servant of the People,” an old TV show starring Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky as the Ukrainian president #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/KjIVhYDGXU https://t.co/UgcX2jOV6Z
French authorities said they seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Igor Sechin, who is among a group of individuals sanctioned by the EU https://t.co/llathLKWSA
Russia’s war on Ukraine has unleashed auto makers’ third supply-chain crisis in as many years https://t.co/Os4rK49MOc

Airlines world-wide are altering routes and canceling flights to avoid Russian airspace, changes that will lengthen journey times and raise costs for carriers that were starting to bounce back from their pandemic slump https://t.co/HFev0calrn
Here's what to know about Russian oligarchs and why they're facing heightened scrutiny by Western governments amid the Ukraine crisis https://t.co/8oLcIOOvNa
A state court judge dismissed the New York Attorney General’s attempt to dissolve the National Rifle Association https://t.co/CJQOfPwXvJ
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/2VUeKsnJtu

The House Jan. 6 panel said in a court filing that it has evidence to suggest former President Trump violated several laws in an attempt to keep Congress from certifying President Biden’s victory https://t.co/0JRMw2uNIH

The U.N. refugee agency says 1 million people have fled Ukraine since Russia’s invasion: "For many millions more, inside Ukraine, it’s time for guns to fall silent, so that life-saving humanitarian assistance can be provided." https://t.co/bO4o17jBVS

The Florida teen who garnered attention for tracking Elon Musk’s private jet is now publicizing the movements of planes owned by Russian oligarchs and aircraft associated with Vladimir Putin https://t.co/1f5b1MKdSt
Apple sent an invitation for a product-launch event scheduled for March 8, which is expected to reveal a new, cheaper iPhone https://t.co/jPdFhWKlgb

A Texas judge granted a request by the parents of a transgender teen girl to temporarily forbid the state from investigating whether helping their daughter obtain certain medical treatments constituted child abuse https://t.co/11VKVZnArh

Elon Musk offered advice to Ukraine Wednesday on how to keep Starlink, the satellite-based internet service provided by SpaceX, operating as the country battles invading Russian forces https://t.co/ljn4ozbVDI
Major League Baseball canceled its opening games after owners and locked-out players failed to agree on a new labor contract https://t.co/UFCUT79oya

Russian missile debris fell near Kyiv’s central train station on Wednesday night, where thousands of civilians are sheltering as they await evacuation. Ukrainian officials said the missile was shot down by Kyiv’s air defenses. https://t.co/YD0tScL6vK

Russia’s Defense Ministry acknowledged extensive losses for the first time, saying 498 Russian troops have been killed. Ukraine hasn’t released casualties, but says its military has killed 5,840 Russian troops, and put civilian death toll at about 2,000. https://t.co/nFLUGr5AXi
U.S. officials are increasingly concerned that Sudan’s military junta will allow Russia to build a naval base on the country’s strategic Red Sea coast https://t.co/uj1HxCCmyy
Roughly $1.2 billion of Visa's annual net revenue comes from Russia and Ukraine, where sanctions and war have made it difficult to do business https://t.co/UIvRTQH3YC

Ukraine’s government is seeking a fast track to join the European Union as the country fights a Russian invasion. Here's why Ukraine’s request for EU membership is a long shot. https://t.co/bmDWM5hPFz
Former Illinois House Speaker Michael Madigan was indicted Wednesday by a federal grand jury on charges of racketeering conspiracy, bribery, wire fraud and extortion https://t.co/isYFrvkbZB

From @WSJopinion: Putin’s isolation and miscalculation make him dangerous but they also make him vulnerable, writes @HolmanJenkins. His regime is destroying itself over a fictional threat of NATO aggression. https://t.co/IyAQZLhXJY

From @WSJopinion: Olaf Scholz has risen to the occasion. Now it is President Biden’s turn, writes @BillGalston. As Germany begins its rearmament, the U.S. must continue to help Ukraine’s resistance. https://t.co/AoHtkIOozs
Amid an increasingly violent Russian invasion, Ukraine’s long-vibrant software sector is managing to churn out code for clients overseas and help the country’s war effort https://t.co/jXPeyf8tru

The International Court of Justice has scheduled public hearings beginning Monday on Ukraine’s claims against Russia under the Genocide Convention, expediting proceedings in light of Moscow’s February invasion of its neighbor https://t.co/93Y3gFsqz4

To Ukrainian Jews, Russian President Vladimir Putin’s false claims that Kyiv is controlled by American-sponsored neo-Nazis is an insult to the memory of the Holocaust, especially now that Moscow is indiscriminately shelling Ukrainian cities https://t.co/SCsFZFsYWh
While Vladimir Putin faces united Western opposition to his Ukraine onslaught, a key question for him and his economy is where China and India will land, writes @GeraldFSeib https://t.co/v3M7s9Ipse

From @WSJopinion: European governments are scrambling to shore up their natural gas supply if Russia cuts off exports. But one question worth raising: How in the world did Europe leave itself so vulnerable to Vladimir Putin’s energy extortion? https://t.co/ByQjX4vMK0

The Biden administration has canceled a routine test launch of an Air Force Minuteman III missile to avoid escalating nuclear tensions with Russia, U.S. officials said Wednesday https://t.co/Wv1ImwTd6s
The U.S. and its NATO allies are coming under increasing pressure to do more to help Ukraine, even as they face diminishing options for doing so https://t.co/3TYes6n4bU
Putin sees NATO as a threat and has sought to use Ukraine's potential membership as a reason for his invasion. Here's what to know about the alliance. https://t.co/PrBWsyCld8

Local residents and doctors in a Belarusian border city said a steady flow of wounded Russian soldiers have arrived for treatment in recent days. “There has been a constant flow.” https://t.co/zVf5Oj2RWv

U.N. members voted 141 to 5 to condemn Russian President Vladimir Putin’s “special military operation” in Ukraine and affirm that no territorial gains stemming from the use of force—or threatened use of force—will be recognized as legal there https://t.co/tnnULqwowR

Russian tycoon Roman Abramovich is trying to sell his English soccer club Chelsea FC, a person familiar with the matter said, amid calls by some U.K. lawmakers for him to face sanctions over his past ties to the Kremlin https://t.co/J0j2WBtnPT
After playing down U.S. warnings of a Russian invasion, China is struggling to evacuate its citizens—while fighting a perception in Ukraine that it has sided with Moscow https://t.co/GmdO7s6ZlE

During President Biden’s State of the Nation address, he garnered bipartisan applause as he warned Russia that more coordinated measures were coming in response to its invasion of Ukraine. He also laid out ways to help tame inflation. https://t.co/F4mq3vHLe6
Jihadist cells in Africa are infiltrating as far as Ghana and Ivory Coast, the world’s top cocoa producers, as western counterterrorism strategy stutters https://t.co/PJHAQZaN8p
The Biden administration is preparing to confront China on its industrial subsidies and seek ways to protect America’s edge in new technologies https://t.co/tdLblB0639

In his prepared #SOTU remarks, President Biden mentioned Afghanistan only in reference to supporting American veterans and mentioned China just twice, leaving thorny foreign policy challenges unmentioned https://t.co/mHOvvEgfjS

President Biden announced new sanctions against Russia in his first State of the Union address and sought to reassure Americans that the U.S. economy would face limited knock-on effects #SOTU #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/p6WKS4IX9l https://t.co/Mebg0S0VT9
President Biden will say in his State of the Union address that Putin miscalculated by invading Ukraine and underestimated the response from Western allies https://t.co/QDiSbSARZS
Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell rebuked a policy agenda crafted by fellow Republican Sen. Rick Scott, saying it would raise taxes on lower-income Americans https://t.co/QV4C5ETqPg
Russian forces resumed airstrikes on Ukraine’s second-largest city and continued pounding other cities as they sought to break the will of Ukraine’s resistance https://t.co/uLJpkYSy8e
The 60,000-ton merchant ship that caught fire last month carrying around 4,000 Lamborghini, Porsche, Bentley, Audi, and Volkswagen vehicles sank in the Atlantic Ocean https://t.co/vY3HpZkWqj
President Biden united the room in solidarity with Ukraine during his State of the Union address, but it didn’t last. Here are six takeaways from his first #SOTU. https://t.co/1OOrvpFamF
The Russian invasion of Ukraine has driven demand for cryptocurrencies in both countries, helping boost the price of bitcoin https://t.co/5eXGBqsU3R

With a website and social-media channel, Ukrainians are posting about Russian military deaths that Moscow hasn’t disclosed. “Those are the horrors of war launched by your president.” https://t.co/4onVWyKYa3

Global companies with IT staff in Ukraine are working to stay in contact with software teams on the ground in some of the hardest hit areas of the country as invading Russian forces increasingly set their sights on civilian targets https://t.co/V4IW4vnfba
